Key Match Events: Paolo Banchero returned to the Orlando Magic lineup after missing 34 games with a torn right oblique and scored 34 points.
Giannis Antetokounmpo led all scorers with 41 points, along with 14 rebounds, four assists, three steals, and two blocks.
Damian Lillard scored 29 points with seven assists, four rebounds, and three steals.
Orlando Magic lost to the Milwaukee Bucks 109-106.
Paolo Banchero scored 12 of Orlando's final 14 points as a rally fell just short.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Orlando was without Jalen Suggs, sidelined with a lower back strain, and Gary Harris (left hamstring strain).
Jett Howard left the game in the fourth quarter with a left ankle sprain.
With the defeat, the Magic dropped to 22–18, just behind Milwaukee in the East standings.
During Banchero's absence, the Magic went 19–15 and sit in fifth place in the Eastern Conference.
Orlando hosts the Philadelphia 76ers on Sunday, giving Banchero a day of rest.
Milwaukee travels to New York for a matinee versus the Knicks.
The Magic and Bucks face each other again on Jan. 15.
